cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 385 miles SE of Wilmington, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest toward the North Carolina/South Carolina coast, then expected to slow and move inland across the southeastern United States
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: vicinity of Cape Fear–Wilmington, North Carolina

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Duck NC to the NC/VA border, including portions of lower Chesapeake Bay
weather_observation.warning_coast: South Santee River SC to Duck NC, including Albemarle and Pamlico Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Primary impacts along the North Carolina and South Carolina coasts with inland effects spreading into Virginia and the broader Mid-Atlantic
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible late weekend with gusts generally below tropical-storm force
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected in Delaware River or New Jersey back-bays
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain possible Sunday–Monday as remnant circulation lifts northward
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along the New Jersey shore beginning late week
